content:
Sierra Yarn promotes the use of alpaca fiber as a sustainable and eco-friendly option for yarn production. They highlight several benefits of using alpaca fiber, such as:

1. Alpacas do not damage the pasture when grazing.
2. Alpaca feet do not damage the pasture.
3. Alpacas do not use land or water intended for food production.
4. Alpacas are highly efficient animals.
5. The natural colors of alpaca avoid the need for dyeing.
6. Alpaca fiber is highly resistant to flames and is an excellent insulation.
7. Alpacas were tamed between 400 and 5000 B.C.
8. Alpacas had a strong impact on ancient Peruvian cultures.
9. Alpacas are the main source of income for many Andean families.
10. Alpaca fiber has an excellent appearance and durability.
11. Alpaca fiber has a soft touch.
12. Alpaca fiber has high performance in extreme weather conditions.

Sierra yarn emphasizes that alpaca is the best choice for eco-sustainability and for the next time you have to choose between alpaca and any other fiber.
